page.title: 10STANLEY COMMON
page.content: {STANLEY COMMON} Stanley common is a linear settlement based on the A609. This road goes from Belper to Ilkeston. We recall seeing around 100 fields in all. These fields are mostly rough grazing land and derelict fields. In Stanley Common there is 3-4 acres of deciduous woodland. This is called Morleyhayes Wood. There is a little recreation ground. There are 5 farms which are used for different purposes and there is also a dismantled railway. Some of the farms had animals and others had crops like barley and wheat. Hayes Farm is being refurbished as a place for parties to eat out. In the village there is a small sports centre which has enough facilities for the village. There is a fair sized shop which was built as a Co-op but was then changed to Cresswells.
